diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Behçet disease was supported by the presence of painful ulcers on the legs, aphthae on the lower lip and buccal mucosa, and the patient's clinical history following the rabies vaccination. Key findings included non-epithelioid granuloma observed in the colon biopsy and the development of erythematous nodes with ulceration and bleeding, along with systemic involvement such as fever and elevated inflammatory markers.
